analyzed: de nas thar pa dge slong gis gsol pa /
translated: Then Liberated One, the bhikṣu, said,

original: dge slong chen po /
analyzed: dge slong chen po /
translated: “Great bhikṣu,

original: thams cad ji lta ba'i lam dam pa de gang lags /
analyzed: thams cad ji lta ba'i lam dam pa de gang lags /

original: smras pa / ji bzhin nyid de ma bcos na //
analyzed: smras pa / ji bzhin nyid de ma bcos na //

original: nam mkha' la ni sprin bzhin te //

translated: It is like clouds in the sky.

original: d'i ni rnal 'byor dam pa'i lam //
analyzed: d'i ni rnal 'byor dam pa'i lam //

original: de skad ces smras pas /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pas /

original: thar pa g-yog dang bcas pa yid rangs te /
analyzed: thar pa g-yog dang bcas pa yid rangs te /
translated: Vimuktisena and his attendant were delighted.

original: ae ma'o thabs la mkhas so //
analyzed: ae ma'o thabs la mkhas so //
translated: “Ah! Skillful means!

original: nges so // yin no //
analyzed: nges so // yin no //
translated: It is so! It is so!

original: gtad do // bdag thams cad du de la yongs su gnas so zhes gsol te /
analyzed: gtad do // bdag thams cad du de la yongs su gnas so zhes gsol te /
translated: We are completely devoted to him.”

original: sgra ji lta ba de bzhin du spyad pa las thar pa dge slong ni blo gros kyi nges pa ma rnyed de /🔽sgra 'ba' zhig la phyogs pas dngos po bzhi kho nas spyad de zhen nas lus dam pa'i cha byad du bcug nas sems ngan 'gro ba'i lam du zhugs so //🔽g-yog dan bag ni sgra bzhi'i don gyi nges pa rnyed nas blo gros dam par 'brel te don 'ba' zhig la phyogs pas ji bzhin pa kho nar spyad de zhen nas yongs su rnal 'byor pas lus ma rabs kyi cha byad du bcug nas sems dam par nges
analyzed: sgra ji lta ba de bzhin du spyad pa las thar pa dge slong ni blo gros kyi nges pa ma rnyed de / sgra 'ba' zhig la phyogs pas dngos po bzhi kho nas spyad de zhen nas lus dam pa'i cha byad du bcug nas sems ngan 'gro ba'i lam du zhugs so // g-yog dan bag ni sgra bzhi'i don gyi nges pa rnyed nas blo gros dam par 'brel te don 'ba' zhig la phyogs pas ji bzhin pa kho nar spyad de zhen nas yongs su rnal 'byor pas lus ma rabs kyi cha byad du bcug nas sems dam par nges
translated: As the words were spoken, Vimuktisena, the monk, did not find certainty in his understanding,🔽and because he was focused only on the words, he practiced the four things as he understood them. He became attached to them and put on the appearance of a holy man, but his mind entered the path to the lower realms.

original: pa'i lam du zhugs so //
analyzed: pa'i lam du zhugs so //
translated: His attendant, however, found certainty in the meaning of the four statements and became a man of great understanding. He was focused only on the meaning, and he practiced exactly as he understood it. He became attached to it and put on the appearance of an ordinary man, but his mind entered the path to the higher realms.

original: de nas thar pa g-yog dang lta ba ma mthun te /
analyzed: de nas thar pa g-yog dang lta ba ma mthun te /
translated: Then, Moksha and his retinue did not agree with the view.

original: smras pa / bdag cag gnyis ni dpon gcig la sgra gcig tu byung ba 'di la so sor ma mthu pa 'di ji lta zhig /
analyzed: smras pa / bdag cag gnyis ni dpon gcig la sgra gcig tu byung ba 'di la so sor ma mthu pa 'di ji lta zhig /
translated: He said, “We two have the same master, but we have not agreed on this one sound. What is this?”

original: dan bag gis smras pa /
analyzed: dan bag gis smras pa /
translated: Dṛḍhabala said,

original: bdag gis ni da ltar nges par 'jog pa 'di kho na las gzhan ma thos lags so //
analyzed: bdag gis ni da ltar nges par 'jog pa 'di kho na las gzhan ma thos lags so //
translated: “I have not heard anything other than this present ascertainment.”

original: smras pa / bdag @196a *//
analyzed: smras pa / bdag @196a *//
translated: Moksha said,

analyzed: gis kyang da ltar nges pa rnyed de spyod pa 'di kho na las gzhan ma thos so zhes smras pas /
translated: “I have also found ascertainment now. I have not heard anything other than this present conduct.”

original: de la rtsod pa chen por gyur te lta ba ma mthun pas g-yog dang / so sor bskal te ma mthong ma phrad par dam bcas nas g-yog khams ring por bshugs te spangs so //
analyzed: de la rtsod pa chen por gyur te lta ba ma mthun pas g-yog dang / so sor bskal te ma mthong ma phrad par dam bcas nas g-yog khams ring por bshugs te spangs so //
translated: Because they said this, a great dispute arose. Since their views did not agree, they split their retinues and promised not to see or meet each other. They went far away to different realms and abandoned each other.

original: de nas thar pa dge slong de mngon pa'i nga rgyal log pa'i ri bor skyes te dpon la so so'i nges pa rnyed pa gsol ba las dge slong thub dka' gzhon nu ma bcos ma bslad pa'i rnal mar spyod pas kha gsag med de rang bzhin gsong por
analyzed: de nas thar pa dge slong de mngon pa'i nga rgyal log pa'i ri bor skyes te dpon la so so'i nges pa rnyed pa gsol ba las dge slong thub dka' gzhon nu ma bcos ma bslad pa'i rnal mar spyod pas kha gsag med de rang bzhin gsong por
translated: The monk Muktaka, who was practicing the natural state without fabrication or adulteration, was without flattery. He spoke honestly and naturally.

original: smra bas na dan bag ltar nges so zhes bsgo bas thar pa kun nas 'khrugs te /
analyzed: smra bas na dan bag ltar nges so zhes bsgo bas thar pa kun nas 'khrugs te /

original: smras pa / dpon por 'dra na gnyi ga ltar ro zhes kyang ma mnyam par nges par bdag bkar btags pa dang / sun phyung ba 'dis byas pas dpon 'di'ang khams 'dir ma chags par byas la 'di dag bdag gi khams su bya'o zhes dam bcas nas che ba'i nga rgyal skyes te dpon yang khams ring por bshugs te yongs su spangs so //
analyzed: smras pa / dpon por 'dra na gnyi ga ltar ro zhes kyang ma mnyam par nges par bdag bkar btags pa dang / sun phyung ba 'dis byas pas dpon 'di'ang khams 'dir ma chags par byas la 'di dag bdag gi khams su bya'o zhes dam bcas nas che ba'i nga rgyal skyes te dpon yang khams ring por bshugs te yongs su spangs so //
translated: He said, If the master is impartial, both of us are the same. He was certain that the master was not impartial. This master has been made by this refutation. original: de nas thar pa de de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi sgo grangs mang zhing rgya che bar gyur pas thams cad du ston pa dpag par dka' ba'i phyir yongs su ma chud de gzhal ba gnyis kyis gzhal ba za byas par thar pa rang gi tshad ma la

original: yang skye ba de'i phyi ma dag la gsad pa'i sha dang / shi ba'i ro dang / rnam par rul ba dang / lung pa tha dad rdo dang / gam brag dang / sdong chen la sogs pa'i nang du gnas pa'i skye bor gyur te de la gnas shing zas kyang des 'tsho ba gnyen pos gsad cing skye ba 'pho ba 'ba' zhig tu gyur to //
analyzed: yang skye ba de'i phyi ma dag la gsad pa'i sha dang / shi ba'i ro dang / rnam par rul ba dang / lung pa tha dad rdo dang / gam brag dang / sdong chen la sogs pa'i nang du gnas pa'i skye bor gyur te de la gnas shing zas kyang des 'tsho ba gnyen pos gsad cing skye ba 'pho ba 'ba' zhig tu gyur to //
translated: In the next five hundred lives, he was born as a being who lived in the flesh of those who had been killed, in dead bodies, in rotting corpses, in the hollow trunks of trees, in the rocks and cliffs of the mountains, and in the hollow trunks of large trees. He lived on these things and ate them. He was killed by his enemies and his body was cut up.

original: skye ba de'i phyi ma dag la mngal gyi grong khyer na gnas pa'i skye bor skye ba lnga brgya gnas de gnas dang / 'tsho ba'ang de las byed par gyur to //
analyzed: skye ba de'i phyi ma dag la mngal gyi grong khyer na gnas pa'i skye bor skye ba lnga brgya gnas de gnas dang / 'tsho ba'ang de las byed par gyur to //
translated: In the next five hundred lives after that, he was born as a human being living in the city of the womb, and he made his living as a butcher.

original: yang skye ba de'i phyi ma la mnar med pa'i gnas rdo rje dmyal ba zhes bya bar de nyid kyi tshe'i tshad brgyad khri'i bar du gnas te dmyal ba de'i sdug bsngal @197b gyi tshad ni brjod du mi rung ngo //

translated: In the next life after that, he was born in the Vajra Hell of Avīci, where he remained for eighty thousand years, experiencing the unbearable suffering of that hell.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why was that?

translated: If the extent of that suffering were described in front of someone, the person who heard it would faint.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na dmyal ba des /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na dmyal ba des /
translated: At that time, the hell being

analyzed: ae ma'o // 'di ci nyes smras pa'i skad cig gcig gis phyin par gyur to //

original: rdo rje sems dpa' thub pa'i dbang po chos kyi rgyal po des kho na nyid kyi las yin zhes chos bstan pas las de yid la byas pas yongs su shes te 'gyod par gyur to //

translated: The king of the Dharma, the Sage Vajrasattva, taught the Dharma to him, saying, This is the result of your own actions. He understood that by attending to that action, he had regret.

original: 'gyod pa tsam gyis gnas de nas 'phos nas rab tu tsha ba'i dmyal ba'i gnas su'ang de nyid kyi tshe tshad brgyad khrir gnas te mnar med pa ji lta bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gyod pa tsam gyis gnas de nas 'phos nas rab tu tsha ba'i dmyal ba'i gnas su'ang de nyid kyi tshe tshad brgyad khrir gnas te mnar med pa ji lta bzhin no //
translated: Just by regretting it, he was reborn in the hell of Avīci, where he remained for eighty thousand years, just as in the hell of Avīci.

original: de nas yang 'phos nas tsha ba chung du dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / ngu 'bod dang / bsdus 'joms dang / thig gnag dang / 'bar ba dang / yang sos la sogs pa'i dmyal ba'i gnas su'ang de dag gi tshe tshad brgyad khrir gnas te mnar med pa dang /🔽rab tu tsha ba ji lta ba bzhin no //

translated: Then he was reborn in the hells of Saṃjīva, Kālasūtra, Saṃghāta, Raurava, Tapana, Pratāpana, and so on, where he remained for eighty thousand years, just as in Avīci and Pratāpana.

analyzed: de dag nam zhig pa na'ang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gyi dmyal ba rnams su de ltar 'phen no //
translated: When he died in those places, he was reborn in the hells of other world systems, and so on.

translated: Having transmigrated from there, they are born in the place where the world is destroyed by famine, disease, or the sword.

analyzed: 'jig pa de dag gis de dag gang stongs pa'ang gzhan dag gang 'jig pa'i dus su'ang der skye ba len par 'gyur ro //
translated: When those worlds are destroyed, they are born in other places where the world is being destroyed.

analyzed: de dag las thar nas kyang @198a *//
translated: Having been freed from there,

analyzed: sha dang / rus pa'i ched du gsod pa'i skye ba'i rigs su bskal pa brgyad khrir skye ba len cing 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they are born in a family of butchers, and transmigrate for eighty thousand eons.

original: de las thar nas gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi khams su skye ba lnga brgyar gdung bar gyur to //🔽de las 'phos nas lus srul po'i rigs su skye ba blangs so //
analyzed: de las thar nas gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi khams su skye ba lnga brgyar gdung bar gyur to // de las 'phos nas lus srul po'i rigs su skye ba blangs so //
translated: Having been freed from there, they are born in the world of Yama, and are tormented for five hundred lives.🔽Having transmigrated from there, they are born in the family of outcasts.

original: skye ba de'i phyi ma la she za'i rigs su skye ba blangs so //
analyzed: skye ba de'i phyi ma la she za'i rigs su skye ba blangs so //
translated: In the next life, they are born in the family of cannibals.

original: skye ba de'i phyi ma la srul po'i rigs su skye ba blangs te srul po gnya' dreg can zhes bya ba'i bu srul po gtogs 'dod can zhes bya bar skye ba blangs so //
analyzed: skye ba de'i phyi ma la srul po'i rigs su skye ba blangs te srul po gnya' dreg can zhes bya ba'i bu srul po gtogs 'dod can zhes bya bar skye ba blangs so //
translated: In the next life after that, he was born in the caste of outcasts and took birth as the son of a filthy outcast named “Filth-Neck” and was called “Filth-Desire.”

original: skye ba de'i phyi ma la yul lang ka pu ra zhes bya ba'i smad 'tshong ma zhig gi mngal du chags te skye bar smin to //
analyzed: skye ba de'i phyi ma la yul lang ka pu ra zhes bya ba'i smad 'tshong ma zhig gi mngal du chags te skye bar smin to //
translated: In the next life after that, he was conceived in the womb of a prostitute in the land called Lanka-pura and was born.🔽When he was born there, after nine months his mother died, and people said, “This is the son of a bastard. Who will be the one to raise him?” So it was proper to leave him in the lap of his mother.

original: de der skye ba blangs te zla ba dgu na ma shi bar gyur pa dang / mi gang dag gis dva bu rkog bu 'di gso ba byar yul gang smre bar 'gyur bas ma'i mchan du bzhag par rigs so zhes glengs nas dug shing nal bye zhes bya ba'i rtsa na dur phag gti mug gi tshang 'chas pa'i bar du dug sbrul zhe sdang
analyzed: de der skye ba blangs te zla ba dgu na ma shi bar gyur pa dang / mi gang dag gis dva bu rkog bu 'di gso ba byar yul gang smre bar 'gyur bas ma'i mchan du bzhag par rigs so zhes glengs nas dug shing nal bye zhes bya ba'i rtsa na dur phag gti mug gi tshang 'chas pa'i bar du dug sbrul zhe sdang
translated: They said, “It is proper to leave him in the lap of his mother.”

original: gi 'khras sar byed pa kha la 'dod chags dug bya'i tshang 'chas pa'i rtsar kun gyis ma'i ro khang brtsigs te ro khyogs la blangs te der bcug nas bu'ang ro mchan du gzhag go /
analyzed: gi 'khras sar byed pa kha la 'dod chags dug bya'i tshang 'chas pa'i rtsar kun gyis ma'i ro khang brtsigs te ro khyogs la blangs te der bcug nas bu'ang ro mchan du gzhag go /
translated: The people of the town built a funeral pyre of dry wood and placed the mother's corpse on it. They put the child on the corpse and set fire to the pyre.

original: dva bu des ma'i ro la 'jus nas nu ma la 'jibs pas chu ser du drangs te zhag bdun gyi 'tsho ba byas so //
analyzed: dva bu des ma'i ro la 'jus nas nu ma la 'jibs pas chu ser du drangs te zhag bdun gyi 'tsho ba byas so //
translated: The child clung to the mother's corpse and sucked her breast. He lived for seven days on the lymph that flowed from her breast.

original: de nas khrag tu 'jibs pas @198b zhag bdun gyi 'tsho bas 'tsho'o //
analyzed: de nas khrag tu 'jibs pas @198b zhag bdun gyi 'tsho bas 'tsho'o //
translated: Then he sucked her blood and lived for seven days on that.

original: de nas nu ma zos pas zhag bcu'i 'tsho bas 'tsho'o //
analyzed: de nas nu ma zos pas zhag bcu'i 'tsho bas 'tsho'o //
translated: Then he ate her flesh and lived for ten days on that.

original: de nas ma'i nang grol zad pas zos pas 'tsho ba'i bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas ma'i nang grol zad pas zos pas 'tsho ba'i bya bar gyur to //
translated: Then he ate her intestines and lived on that.

original: de nas sha zad par zos pas zla ba bdun gyi tsho ba'i bya ba byas so //
analyzed: de nas sha zad par zos pas zla ba bdun gyi tsho ba'i bya ba byas so //
translated: Then he ate her flesh until it was all gone and lived on that for seven months.

original: de nas gzhon nu de rtas par gyur nas dur khrod kyi ro rnams kyis 'tsho ba'i bya ba byas so //
analyzed: de nas gzhon nu de rtas par gyur nas dur khrod kyi ro rnams kyis 'tsho ba'i bya ba byas so //
translated: Then the child grew up and lived on the corpses in the charnel ground.

original: de nas shin tu rtas par gyur pa dang ro rnams zas su za zhing ro gos dang / pags pa rnams gyon te dur khrod kyi ma mo dang / sha za dang / yi dvags kyi tshogs dang / mi ma lags pa'i tshogs mang po'ang mi ro rnams kyi sha rjen zos pa'i rang bzhin gyi mthus dbang du 'dus te dur khrod kyi gdug pa can kun gyi bdag por gyur te gzhan gyi gzi byin 'phrog pa /
analyzed: de nas shin tu rtas par gyur pa dang ro rnams zas su za zhing ro gos dang / pags pa rnams gyon te dur khrod kyi ma mo dang / sha za dang / yi dvags kyi tshogs dang / mi ma lags pa'i tshogs mang po'ang mi ro rnams kyi sha rjen zos pa'i rang bzhin gyi mthus dbang du 'dus te dur khrod kyi gdug pa can kun gyi bdag por gyur te gzhan gyi gzi byin 'phrog pa /
translated: Then, when he had grown very strong, he ate the corpses and wore their skin and bones. He became the lord of the many assemblies of the daka-dakinis, flesh-eaters, and ghosts of the charnel grounds. By the power of his nature of eating the raw flesh of human corpses, he became the lord of all the evil spirits of the charnel grounds, and he stole the splendor of others.

original: mi gang dang / gang dag gson por za zhing mdangs 'phrog pa /
analyzed: mi gang dang / gang dag gson por za zhing mdangs 'phrog pa /
translated: He ate some people alive and stole their splendor.

original: shin tu 'jigs pa'i gzugs can ma rungs par gyur to //
analyzed: shin tu 'jigs pa'i gzugs can ma rungs par gyur to //
translated: He became very frightening and evil.

original: ma'i sha rjen zos pas na ma za na ma tang ka zhes ming gang dag gis yongs su grags so //
analyzed: ma'i sha rjen zos pas na ma za na ma tang ka zhes ming gang dag gis yongs su grags so //
translated: Because he ate his mother's raw flesh, he was known by the name of Matamga, the one who eats his mother.

original: yi dvags chen po de'i kha rlangs las ni tsha ba'i nad byung bas 'byung bas khyab ste 'gro ba gang lus can rnams zug rdu drag pos gzir ba /

translated: From the breath of that great ghost came a hot disease that spread through the elements. He afflicted all embodied beings with sharp pain.

original: sna nas grang ba'i nad byung bas 'byung ba khyab ste kun du gdung bar byed do //
analyzed: sna nas grang ba'i nad byung bas 'byung ba khyab ste kun du gdung bar byed do //

analyzed: mig dug gis phog pas 'chi bar nges pa /

translated: Then the great lord of Lanka and the other rakshasa hordes prepared an army and made an effort to conquer him.

analyzed: nga ni dbang phyug chen po ste //

analyzed: la la ni 'di ni srin po'i khams rgyal bar byed ba zhig ste bdag cag gi gtso bor 'os so zhes sgrogs /

analyzed: la la dag 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i dbang phyug chen po zhig go zhes sgrogs /

original: srin po'i rgyal po lang ka'i mnga' bdag ni 'di ni 'byung po'i bu gtogs 'dod can zhes bya ba yin te 'jig rten gsum sgrag pa de kho na nyid ma gtogs pa thams cad rlag cing dbang du byed pa log pa'i tshogs bdag ste /
analyzed: srin po'i rgyal po lang ka'i mnga' bdag ni 'di ni 'byung po'i bu gtogs 'dod can zhes bya ba yin te 'jig rten gsum sgrag pa de kho na nyid ma gtogs pa thams cad rlag cing dbang du byed pa log pa'i tshogs bdag ste /
translated: The king of the rākṣasas, the lord of Laṇkā, proclaimed, “This is the son of the bhūta named Kaṇṭhaka. He is the lord of the assembly of the perverse who destroys and subjugates all three worlds except for the one who is the proclamation of reality.🔽He cannot be subdued by others. His antidote was created by the buddhas, the bhagavats. Having been subdued by the emanation Vajrī, he was placed in the highest certainty and was truly prophesied.

original: 'di gzhan gyis mi thul te 'di'i gnyen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mdzad de sbrul pa rdo rje can gyis btul nas nges pa dam par bkod de yang dag par lung ston pa zhig pas 'di'i rgyus gsang sngags dam pa'i nges pa theg pa chen
analyzed: 'di gzhan gyis mi thul te 'di'i gnyen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mdzad de sbrul pa rdo rje can gyis btul nas nges pa dam par bkod de yang dag par lung ston pa zhig pas 'di'i rgyus gsang sngags dam pa'i nges pa theg pa chen
translated: Therefore, the certainty of the sublime secret mantra, the Mahāyāna,

analyzed: po rmad du byung ba'i chos 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur nges te /
translated: The great being said, It is certain that a marvelous Dharma will appear in the world.

original: bdag cag kyang 'di'i g-yog tu byas nas sangs rgyas rdo rje snying po'i zhal mthong zhing gsang sngags dam pa'i nges pa rnyed par 'gyur bas 'di la nges par 'dun pa 'dun cig ces bsgo bas /🔽srin po'i tshogs rnams yid rangs te rang gi sde dpon ci smra ba mi 'dor bar de ltar 'dun pas na kun srin po bya'i gshog pa can de'i g-yog tu dod ste kun gyis smras pa /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang 'di'i g-yog tu byas nas sangs rgyas rdo rje snying po'i zhal mthong zhing gsang sngags dam pa'i nges pa rnyed par 'gyur bas 'di la nges par 'dun pa 'dun cig ces bsgo bas / srin po'i tshogs rnams yid rangs te rang gi sde dpon ci smra ba mi 'dor bar de ltar 'dun pas na kun srin po bya'i gshog pa can de'i g-yog tu dod ste kun gyis smras pa /
translated: We should serve him. We will see the face of the Buddha Vajra Essence and find the certainty of the excellent secret mantra.🔽 The assembly of rakshasas were pleased and, not rejecting what their leader said, they all agreed.

original: bdag cag kyang dbang phyug chen po kho na nyid ltar 'dun no zhes grags te gtso bo dam par 'dzin to //
analyzed: bdag cag kyang dbang phyug chen po kho na nyid ltar 'dun no zhes grags te gtso bo dam par 'dzin to //
translated: Since they all agreed, they all became the retinue of the rakshasa with the wings of a bird. They all said, We also agree to be like Mahesvara himself. They held him as the highest leader.

original: des de dag 'khor du 'dzin par byas so //
analyzed: des de dag 'khor du 'dzin par byas so //
translated: He accepted them as his retinue.

original: de nas yang srin po bya'i gshog pa can de srin po de'i ded dpon ma tang ka ru tra zhes bya bar grags pa de nga rgyal gyi che ba bcom ste bdag las che ba gang zhig yod /

original: yang su zhig yin /🔽ru tra ma @203a *//
analyzed: yang su zhig yin / ru tra ma @203a *//
translated: Who is greater than me?🔽Rāvaṇa!🔽Rāvaṇa!

original: tra ma ra tra zhes sgra sgrogs pa las /
analyzed: tra ma ra tra zhes sgra sgrogs pa las /
translated: Rāvaṇa!”

original: lha'i ded dpon ma tang ka tra na zhes bya ba mthu dang / rdzu 'phrul thabs dang / che ba khyad par du byung ba de da pags so zhes grags pa las /
analyzed: lha'i ded dpon ma tang ka tra na zhes bya ba mthu dang / rdzu 'phrul thabs dang / che ba khyad par du byung ba de da pags so zhes grags pa las /
translated: The captain of the gods, Maṅkaṭa Rāvaṇa, who was renowned for his power, miracles, skill, and greatness, was killed.

original: bdud ru tra nag po de shin tu 'khams 'khrugs nas nga rgyal gyi gtum skad bsgrags /
analyzed: bdud ru tra nag po de shin tu 'khams 'khrugs nas nga rgyal gyi gtum skad bsgrags /
translated: The evil Rāvaṇa was very upset and roared with the ferocity of pride.

original: rang gi rdzu 'phrul dang / 'phur rtsal gyis ma tang ka ru na'i gnas su babs te yang sad par dzams na /
analyzed: rang gi rdzu 'phrul dang / 'phur rtsal gyis ma tang ka ru na'i gnas su babs te yang sad par dzams na /
translated: With his own miracles and the speed of his wings, he landed in the place of Maṅkara Rāvaṇa and roared again.

original: ja zha mar sad pa mi 'dra nas lus can yin pas 'ud nas 'thabs 'thabs su byung ba'i ngad la tsha grang dbugs ham nas nad kyi mtshon cha spros nas kho na de'i lus la khyab ste /

translated: The various kinds of food and drink, such as tea, beer, and butter, were not in harmony, and so the beings fought and struggled, and the hot and cold breath of their panting became the weapons of disease, which spread through their bodies.

original: lus me dbal nag po'i 'brum pas gang nas mi bzod pa'i zug rdus gdungs te kho na ngo bo de 'ung thabs su bsang ngo //
analyzed: lus me dbal nag po'i 'brum pas gang nas mi bzod pa'i zug rdus gdungs te kho na ngo bo de 'ung thabs su bsang ngo //

original: kho na de'i bam 'dzam bu'i gling du han ba las dge gnas kyi yul brgyad du snang ngo //
analyzed: kho na de'i bam 'dzam bu'i gling du han ba las dge gnas kyi yul brgyad du snang ngo //
translated: The corpse of that being was scattered over the land of Jambudvīpa, and eight countries appeared.

original: 'ud nas kho na nyid bsad pa'i khyo mo dang / bu 'khor rnams ni gnod sbyin bya'i gshog pa can de'i 'khor du jen /
analyzed: 'ud nas kho na nyid bsad pa'i khyo mo dang / bu 'khor rnams ni gnod sbyin bya'i gshog pa can de'i 'khor du jen /
translated: The wife and children who had killed the being became the retinue of the yakṣa with the wings of a bird.

original: lha ma yin dang / sha za dang / ro langs ril bdud de'i sar jen /
analyzed: lha ma yin dang / sha za dang / ro langs ril bdud de'i sar jen /
translated: All the asuras, piśācas, and vetālas became the retinue of that māra.

original: rgyal po bzhi'ang gang gi skyabs su brgyugs kyang yongs su ma thar bar de'i bran du jen /
analyzed: rgyal po bzhi'ang gang gi skyabs su brgyugs kyang yongs su ma thar bar de'i bran du jen /
translated: The four kings, who had fled for refuge, were not completely saved and became his servants.

original: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / drag po la sogs pa kun kyang gang gi skyabs su brgyugs kyang mthar bar de'i bran du jen /
analyzed: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / drag po la sogs pa kun kyang gang gi skyabs su brgyugs kyang mthar bar de'i bran du jen /
